title: i found something beginner bots are demonstrably better at than most humans:
body:
playing against illaoi.
you know why?
because they're programmed to walk in the opposite direction of people doing a lot of damage.
they don't overthink it when illaoi hits an ultimate. they just leave.

it's really that simple.

Yea, people don't realize just how important that ult is for her burst in a fight.  Without her ult the only way she can get anything resembling burst out in a fight is a very luck driven triple hit combo where she is standing next to a tentacle, and the enemy is coming strait at her + tentacle, and she lands EQW(on champ, not spirit) for 3 hits of her tentacle on both them and the spirit.

Seriously, there are two major actions against Illaoi you can't do against her without just giving her free gold.

1v2/3 her in lane post 6 as melees.  Seriously, very stupid move.  Her kit rewards her for having enemies around, fewer enemies means she does less damage.  Bonus points to her if you guys are retarded enough to fight her when she has like 3 tentacles around her and has already marked one of you as vessels.

Let her build up her nest of tentacles freely.  Kill the damn things as they spawn if you can afford to.   Don't just let her spend her level 1 sitting in lane building up 3-4 tentacles that just give her dominance at level 2.  If she is building up a nest and you can't contest her about it, at the very least don't follow her into the damned thing to fight her.  Drag her out of her comfort zone (Her tentacle nest) and she loses a LOT of power.


If you do have to fight her, and she has ult, try to fight her in the middle of a lane/open area, where she has no nearby walls.  If she ults, without a wall it tends to land the newly spawned tentacles outside of it's radius very heavily, more than enough to not be a threat in the fight unless you run to it.  This can provide a degree of safety.

>  If she ults, without a wall it tends to land the newly spawned tentacles outside of it's radius very heavily, more than enough to not be a threat in the fight 

I agree with everything you've said except for this one. That ult seems to ignore the normal rules for where tentacles will spawn, which is really the thing that makes it so dangerous with her kit.

I agree with all of your points except

>If she ults, without a wall it tends to land the newly spawned tentacles outside of it's radius very heavily, more than enough to not be a threat in the fight unless you run to it. This can provide a degree of safety.

The tentacles spawned by her ultimate ignore the rules of her passive, so they can spawn anywhere inside the ultimate range.

Yes, they can.  They also can spawn in some random location somewhat close by.  They are horridly inconsistant when spawned by her ult, and often enough I run into times where my ult spawns a tentacle that is so far away as that I can't trigger it with my W on the target who spawned it when I am running strait at them.

Another thing that helps is to get in the habit of killing all the tentacles that she leaves behind whenever she moves to another area.  Like you said, letting her build that nest is how you lose against her, so if she sieges your turret and is killed or driven back, make sure that you kill all of the tentacles she left behind before leaving.  You get gold, and you reset her foothold in that area.
